column4: Sanofi's new CEO set to deliver revival plan after falling diabetes sales
column5: PARIS  Oct 26 Sanofi's new chief executive is expected to show how he aims to get France's most valuable company back on track   after being hit by lagging diabetes sales and boardroom rows    when he presents his five-year strategic plan on Nov. 6.

column4: Toyota tops global car sales in Sept  outsells VW for third month
column5: TOKYO  Oct 26 Toyota Motor Corp edged out Germany's Volkswagen AG for the third straight month to be the world's top-selling automaker so far this year  amid concerns that sales at the German company may suffer in the aftermath of a diesel emission scandal.

column4: UPS counting on small retailers to save Christmas

column5: NEW YORK The pharmacy at the center of suspicions over Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc's   business practices began as a small pilot project two years ago and quickly grew to account for 7 percent of the drugmaker's revenue.

column5: NEW YORK The one-time hedge fund executive now running a biotech firm at the center of a drug-pricing controversy on Monday said he has bailed from a losing bet he made on another contentious drug maker: Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  .

column4: Short interest piled on Valeant ahead of scathing report
column5: NEW YORK Short interest in U.S.-traded Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc shares  stood at its highest in nearly a year in the first half of October  exchange data showed on Monday  indicating bearish investors were stacking up against the stock even before a negative report torpedoed the shares last week.

column4: UPDATE 1-Valeant bonds steady after analyst call
column5: NEW YORK  Oct 26 (IFR) - Valeant bonds were volatile on Monday morning but steadied after the drugmaker's management sought to alleviate investor fears of potential fraud at the company.

column5: TORONTO  Oct 26 Canada's main stock index ended 1.2 percent lower on Monday  hurt by sharp falls in energy companies  gold miners and other resource stocks  while Valeant Pharmaceutical International Inc shares' 5 percent fall also weighed.

column4: UPDATE 1-NY launches probe into speeds at big Internet broadband providers
column5: Oct 26 New York state's attorney general is probing whether three major Internet providers could be shortchanging consumers by charging them for faster broadband speeds and failing to deliver the speeds being advertised  according to documents seen by Reuters.
